Shipments that reflect working-day differences increased 11.3% from a year earlier, according to data released yesterday by the customs office.

summary: With expectations fading quickly that the US Federal Reserve (Fed) will execute multiple rate cuts this year, all eyes are once again on the ringgit.
content:
PETALING JAYA: With expectations fading quickly that the US Federal Reserve (Fed) will execute multiple rate cuts this year, all eyes are once again on the ringgit.

Recent data had indicated that inflation would remain sticky in the United States, underpinned by a strong job market and persistent consumer demand.

title: Sin-Kung to ride on booming global air cargo market
summary: Sin-Kung Logistics Bhd is expected to ride on the global air cargo volume demand to accelerate its growth.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Sin-Kung Logistics Bhd is expected to ride on the global air cargo volume demand to accelerate its growth.

The ACE Market-bound company, which is set to list on May 15, is influenced by the demand for air cargo volume for its airport-to-airport logistics services.

It specialises in providing airport-to-airport road feeder services for both passenger and cargo airlines.

title: Anwar: Putrajaya will keep eye on inflation rate following civil service pay hike
summary: The government will continue to monitor the impact on inflation in the country following the announcement of a more than 13% increase in civil servants' salaries this December.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 1): The government will continue to monitor the impact on inflation in the country following the announcement of a more than 13% increase in civil servants' salaries this December.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said the government will keep tabs on the implementation of the salary increase and ensure that its revenue remains robust.

“That is why the increase is phased in December and followed through to the following year (2025).

title: More Fed officials ready to say goodbye to low-rate world
summary: A growing number of Federal Reserve officials don't see a return to the ultra-low interest rates that prevailed before the COVID-19 pandemic due to everything from ballooning federal deficits to demand for investments in green energy, artificial intelligence and domestic manufacturing.
content:
File pic — Reuters

A growing number of Federal Reserve officials don't see a return to the ultra-low interest rates that prevailed before the COVID-19 pandemic due to everything from ballooning federal deficits to demand for investments in green energy, artificial intelligence and domestic manufacturing.

title: China travel surges for May holiday but consumers remain wary
summary: TRAVEL by rail and car across China surged on Wednesday, the first day of a major public holiday, as consumers remained focused on keeping expenses down in a challenged economy.
content:
FILE PHOTO: A woman helps a child to climb the stairs amid tourists visiting the Badaling section of the Great Wall, in Beijing, China October 1, 2023. REUTERS/Florence Lo/File Photo

TRAVEL by rail and car across China surged on Wednesday, the first day of a major public holiday, as consumers remained focused on keeping expenses down in a challenged economy.

title: Saudi Arabia's Q1 GDP shrinks by estimated 1.8pc  y/y as oil sector weighs
summary: RIYADH: Saudi Arabia's real gross domestic product (GDP) decreased 1.8 per cent year-on-year in the first quarter, flash estimates by the government's statistical authority showed on Wednesday, as a decline in oil activities continued to hurt overall growth.The ...
content:
RIYADH: Saudi Arabia's real gross domestic product (GDP) decreased 1.8 per cent year-on-year in the first quarter, flash estimates by the government's statistical authority showed on Wednesday, as a decline in oil activities continued to hurt overall growth.

The kingdom's GDP had shrunk 3.7 per cent in the fourth quarter of 2023, as cuts to oil production and lower crude prices weighed on the economy.

Saudi Arabia, the world's largest oil exporter, is pumping around 9 million barrels per day (bpd), wel

title: Investors wait to see Red Sea in shippers' Q1 numbers
summary: LONDON: European shipping firms Maersk and Hapag-Lloyd are unlikely to get a big boost from soaring freight rates due to the Red Sea crisis in the first quarter, reinforcing worries about overcapacity in the long run.Spot freight rates tripled ...
content:
LONDON: European shipping firms Maersk and Hapag-Lloyd are unlikely to get a big boost from soaring freight rates due to the Red Sea crisis in the first quarter, reinforcing worries about overcapacity in the long run.

Spot freight rates tripled to almost US$3,500 a container after vessels began avoiding the Red Sea due to attacks by Houthi militants, the Freightos Baltic Index showed.

Since then, they have eased back to about US$2,400.

That compares to the pandemic peak of US$11,137, a time when shippers ordered new

title: Dollar near five-month highs ahead of Fed policy decision
summary: LONDON: The dollar edged towards its highest level this year against a basket of peers and U.S. share futures dipped on Wednesday ahead of a Federal Reserve policy decision, though trading was thin with many European and Asian markets closed.
content:
LONDON: The dollar edged towards its highest level this year against a basket of peers and U.S. share futures dipped on Wednesday ahead of a Federal Reserve policy decision, though trading was thin with many European and Asian markets closed.

The dollar gained over 0.5% on Tuesday on all six currencies that make up the dollar index, leaving the gauge at 106.49, a whisker off its highest since November.

The euro was under pressure at $1.0664, heading back to its mid Apr

title: Dollar nears year high after pre-Fed data shock, yen slips
summary: LONDON: The dollar inched towards its highest level since November on Wednesday ahead of a Federal Reserve interest rate decision later in the day, after data on Tuesday showed more signs of inflationary pressure in the U.S. economy.Meanwhile, ...
content:
LONDON: The dollar inched towards its highest level since November on Wednesday ahead of a Federal Reserve interest rate decision later in the day, after data on Tuesday showed more signs of inflationary pressure in the U.S. economy.

Meanwhile, the yen dipped to its lowest level since suspected intervention by Japanese authorities on Monday, as traders tested the resolve of the Ministry of Finance.

The dollar index, which tracks the currency against six major peers, rose 0.066 per cent at 106.370, after earlier nearing th

title: Crypto washout sends bitcoin below US$58,000 into bear market
summary: LONDON: Bitcoin fell for a third day on Wednesday, having posted its worst monthly performance in April since late 2022, as investors pulled money out of cryptocurrencies ahead of an interest rate decision by the Federal Reserve later.
content:
LONDON: Bitcoin fell for a third day on Wednesday, having posted its worst monthly performance in April since late 2022, as investors pulled money out of cryptocurrencies ahead of an interest rate decision by the Federal Reserve later.

The value of the world's most traded cryptocurrency fell by nearly 16% in April, as investors booked profits on a sizzling rally that has taken the price to record highs above $70,000.

Bitcoin was last down 4.7% to $57,055, its lowest si

title: Those who spread lies on Forest City casino project ought to be jailed, says PM
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has emphasised that any party associating him and the government with a purported casino project in Forest City must face legal action.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 1): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has emphasised that any party associating him and the government with a purported casino project in Forest City must face legal action.

Describing those behind the allegations as politically bankrupt, Anwar said in this matter, His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia had never broached the idea of organising gambling in Forest City.

title: Oil falls for a third day as Middle East ceasefire hopes rise
summary: OIL prices fell for a third day on Wednesday amid increasing hopes of a ceasefire agreement in the Middle East and on rising crude inventories and production in the U.S., the world's biggest oil consumer.
content:
OIL prices fell for a third day on Wednesday amid increasing hopes of a ceasefire agreement in the Middle East and on rising crude inventories and production in the U.S., the world's biggest oil consumer.

Both oil price benchmarks were down more than 1% at 0650 GMT. Brent crude futures for July were 88 cents lower at $85.45 a barrel, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude futures for June were 90 cents lower at $81.03 per barrel.

Expectations that a ceasefire agreeme

content:

Housing affordability remains a key concern among Malaysians, and property development and construction industries have been addressing the issue to make homes affordable for more people.

title: Fuel prices unchanged till May 8
summary: The retail price of RON97 petrol remains unchanged at RM3.47 per litre, with RON95 also unchanged at RM2.05 per litre, from May 2 to May 8, according to the Ministry of Finance on Wednesday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): The retail price of RON97 petrol remains unchanged at RM3.47 per litre, with RON95 also unchanged at RM2.05 per litre, from May 2 to May 8, according to the Ministry of Finance on Wednesday.

In a statement, the ministry said the retail price of diesel also remains at RM2.15 per litre.

The prices are based on weekly retail pricing of petroleum products using the Automatic Pricing Mechanism formula.

TOKYO: Japan's Nikkei share average closed lower on Wednesday, with traders maintaining a cautious stance on the first day of the month ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve's monetary policy decision.

title: Dr M’s son Mirzan planning US$100m Africa investment
summary:
(May 1): Mirzan Mahathir, the son of former Malaysian prime minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, intends to invest US$100 million (RM477 million) in a cement factory in South Sudan.

If approvals are granted timeously, the plant should be operational in 24 months and will use limestone from...
content:
(May 1): Mirzan Mahathir, the son of former Malaysian prime minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, intends to invest US$100 million (RM477 million) in a cement factory in South Sudan.

If approvals are granted timeously, the plant should be operational in 24 months and will use limestone from Kapoeta, 275 kilometres (170 miles) east of Juba, the capital.

“Juba, being the main market for cement, is a good location for us,” Mirzan told journalists on Tuesday.

content:

title: AirAsia can handle volatile currency movements, oil prices — Tony Fernandes
summary: AirAsia believes it is capable of dealing with rising fuel prices and unfavourable currency movements, which continue to heighten global challenges.
content:
PHNOM PENH (May 1): AirAsia believes it is capable of dealing with rising fuel prices and unfavourable currency movements, which continue to heighten global challenges.

Capital A Bhd chief executive officer (CEO) Tan Sri Tony Fernandes said his confidence is based on the returned elasticity of the aviation industry post-Covid-19, despite fares rising as much as 25% based on US$110 per barrel jet fuel.

title: CEO of water supply company, business owner remanded in graft probe
summary: A water supply company chief executive officer and a company owner have been remanded for three days starting Wednesday to facilitate an ongoing graft investigation into bribery and false claims.
content:
JOHOR (May 1): A water supply company chief executive officer and a company owner have been remanded for three days starting Wednesday to facilitate an ongoing graft investigation into bribery and false claims.

The remand order against the two men aged 38 and 35 was issued by magistrate Nurmadiana Mamat this morning.

The two men were arrested at the Selangor Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) office at about 4pm Tuesday before they were brought to Johor

title: Details of civil servants’ wage hike to be announced in Budget 2025, says Fahmi
summary: Details regarding the salary increase for civil servants will be announced during the tabling of Budget 2025 in October this year.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 1): Details regarding the salary increase for civil servants will be announced during the tabling of Budget 2025 in October this year.

Unity government spokesperson Fahmi Fadzil said that the salary increase of more than 13% announced by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Wednesday clearly demonstrates the government's commitment to civil servants.

“The prime minister's announcement today is very positive. I believe this is what the worker

title: Musk disbands Tesla EV charging team, leaving customers in the dark
summary: DETROIT: Elon Musk's abrupt decision to lay off employees who ran Tesla's electric vehicle charging business blindsided automakers gearing up to equip new EVs for customers to use the Tesla Supercharger network, industry officials and analysts said on Tuesday.
content:
- PHOTO: REUTERS

DETROIT: Elon Musk's abrupt decision to lay off employees who ran Tesla's electric vehicle charging business blindsided automakers gearing up to equip new EVs for customers to use the Tesla Supercharger network, industry officials and analysts said on Tuesday.

For now, General Motors, Ford and other automakers which struck deals last year to give customers access to the network said they are not changing their plans.

title: PM unveils framework for national HR policy
summary:
PUTRAJAYA (May 1): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Wednesday launched the national human resources policy framework, which addresses key aspects including equitable compensation and job welfare.

Minister of Human Resources Steven Sim Chee Keong stated that the framework, whic...
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 1): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Wednesday launched the national human resources policy framework, which addresses key aspects including equitable compensation and job welfare.

Minister of Human Resources Steven Sim Chee Keong stated that the framework, which comprises three core objectives and 11 strategies, was developed after considering feedback from stakeholders and the public through engagement sessions, focus group discussions and online surveys.

title: Transport minister says keeping tabs on Mount Ruang volcanic activity
summary:
HULU SELANGOR (May 1): The Ministry of Transport (MOT) is closely monitoring developments at Mount Ruang, Indonesia which was reported to have erupted three times on Tuesday, spewing lava with ash spreading to as far as Malaysia.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said that the eruptions h...
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 1): The Ministry of Transport (MOT) is closely monitoring developments at Mount Ruang, Indonesia which was reported to have erupted three times on Tuesday, spewing lava with ash spreading to as far as Malaysia.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said that the eruptions have affected Sabah’s Tawau airspace, causing some flights to the district to be diverted to Kota Kinabalu on Tuesday.

title: Johor corporates urged to boost automation, technology adoption and wages
summary: Johor must push for a higher rate of automation, adoption of new technologies as well as higher wages across the board to capitalise on the Johor-Singapore Special Economic Zone (JS-SEZ), Deputy Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Liew Chin Tong said.
content:
(May 1): Johor must push for a higher rate of automation, adoption of new technologies as well as higher wages across the board to capitalise on the Johor-Singapore Special Economic Zone (JS-SEZ), Deputy Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Liew Chin Tong said.

There is little point in complaining about Malaysian firms losing workers to Singapore. Instead, local companies should create more quality jobs with better pay for Malaysian workers, he said in a Facebook post on Wednesday.

summary: WASHINGTON: U.S. central bank officials will conclude their latest two-day policy meeting on Wednesday with a new statement and comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell that could give a clearer sense of how recent disappointing inflation readings have ...
content:
WASHINGTON: U.S. central bank officials will conclude their latest two-day policy meeting on Wednesday with a new statement and comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell that could give a clearer sense of how recent disappointing inflation readings have changed the expectation for interest rate cuts this year.

title: Gold hits near four-week low as traders ready for Fed verdict
summary: GOLD prices fell on Wednesday to their lowest level in nearly four weeks as investors looked towards a U.S. Federal Reserve policy decision that could offer for more cues on its rate-cut timeline.
content:
GOLD prices fell on Wednesday to their lowest level in nearly four weeks as investors looked towards a U.S. Federal Reserve policy decision that could offer for more cues on its rate-cut timeline.

Spot gold was down 0.1% at $2,284.44 per ounce as of 0436 GMT, after hitting its lowest level since April 5 earlier in the session. Prices fell as much as 2% on Tuesday due to an uptick in the dollar and U.S. Treasury yields.

title: Anwar announces over 13% salary hike for civil servants
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Wednesday announced that civil servants will enjoy a salary hike of more than 13% starting December this year, among the highest increase in the nation’s history.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (May 1): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Wednesday announced that civil servants will enjoy a salary hike of more than 13% starting December this year, among the highest increase in the nation’s history.

He said the increase would involve an allocation of over RM10 billion.

“The increase will be more than 13%...among the best increase in history by the Madani government,” he said in his speech when officiating the National Labour Day 2024 ce

title: Microsoft to open first regional data centre in Thailand
summary: BANGKOK: Microsoft will open its first regional data centre in Thailand, the tech giant said on Wednesday, as it looks to boost availability of cloud services.
content:
A view shows a Microsoft logo at Microsoft offices in Issy-les-Moulineaux near Paris, France, January 25, 2023. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes/File Photo

BANGKOK: Microsoft will open its first regional data centre in Thailand, the tech giant said on Wednesday, as it looks to boost availability of cloud services.

The news comes a day after Chief Executive Satya Nadella announced investments worth $1.7 billion investments in artificial intelligence (AI) and clou

title: South Korea exports rise for seventh month on growing chip demand
summary: SEOUL: South Korea's exports rose for a seventh straight month in April, trade data showed on Wednesday, as strong demand for chips continued to lead growth while automobile sales and U.S. shipments climbed to record highs.
content:
SEOUL: South Korea's exports rose for a seventh straight month in April, trade data showed on Wednesday, as strong demand for chips continued to lead growth while automobile sales and U.S. shipments climbed to record highs.

Overseas sales by Asia's fourth-largest economy rose 13.8% from the same month a year earlier to $56.26 billion, a bit higher than a rise of 13.7% tipped in a Reuters survey of economists.

It came after a 3.1% rise in the prior month, which was the

title: Semiconductor plan timely for Malaysia to secure position at global supply chain’s forefront
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The formulation of a comprehensive semiconductor plan is timely for Malaysia to secure a position at the forefront of the global supply chain, according to InvestPenang chief executive officer Loo Lee Lian.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The formulation of a comprehensive semiconductor plan is timely for Malaysia to secure a position at the forefront of the global supply chain, according to InvestPenang chief executive officer Datuk Loo Lee Lian.

She said environmental, social, and governance (ESG) elements, such as net zero carbon emissions as well as sustainable energy and water, must be abided by under the strategic plan.

Loo added that clear objectives and milestones should be incorpo

title: Marrybrown spreading its wings to Cambodia, Uzbekistan
summary: JOHOR BAHRU: Malaysian-based halal-certified fast food restaurant chain Marrybrown is set to expand into new international markets with the opening of outlets in Cambodia and Uzbekistan this year.Marrybrown Sdn Bhd chief financial officer David Liew said the expansion of ...
content:
JOHOR BAHRU: Malaysian-based halal-certified fast food restaurant chain Marrybrown is set to expand into new international markets with the opening of outlets in Cambodia and Uzbekistan this year.

Marrybrown Sdn Bhd chief financial officer David Liew said the expansion of outlets into these two countries reflects the growing recognition of Marrybrown's image and brand in the international market.

"We are committed to strengthening our brand by offering our diverse menu options to both local and overseas communities.<

title: McDonald's posts rare profit miss as customers turn picky
summary: McDonald's missed quarterly profit estimates for the first time in two years as budget-conscious consumers looked past its offers and the Middle East conflict weighed on the burger chain's international sales.
content:
McDonald's missed quarterly profit estimates for the first time in two years as budget-conscious consumers looked past its offers and the Middle East conflict weighed on the burger chain's international sales.

Global comparable sales growth slid for the fourth straight quarter to 1.9%, with the company saying consumers turned "more discriminating with every dollar they spend". Analysts had estimated a 2.35% rise, according to LSEG data.

"Consumer is certainly being ver

title: Property: To buy or rent, that is the question
summary:
The popularity of property investing among the younger investors seems to be waning. The mismatch between one’s salary and property price is a key reason. However, financial planning experts say these investors should not be hasty in dismissing property as an attractive asset class.

Red...
content:
This article first appeared in Wealth, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on April 22, 2024 - April 28, 2024

The popularity of property investing among the younger investors seems to be waning. The mismatch between one’s salary and property price is a key reason. However, financial planning experts say these investors should not be hasty in dismissing property as an attractive asset class.

title: Oil falls for a third day as U.S. crude inventories swell
summary: NEW YORK: Oil prices fell for a third day on Wednesday on rising crude inventories and production in the U.S., the world's biggest oil consumer, along with increasing hopes of a ceasefire agreement in the Middle East.
content:
NEW YORK: Oil prices fell for a third day on Wednesday on rising crude inventories and production in the U.S., the world's biggest oil consumer, along with increasing hopes of a ceasefire agreement in the Middle East.

Brent crude futures for July fell 47 cents, or 0.5%, at $85.86 a barrel by 0005 GMT. U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude for June declined 53 cents, or 0.6%, to $81.40 per barrel.

U.S. crude oil inventories swelled last week by 4.906 million barrels, while

title: Johor police nab 11 involved in job, investment scams
summary: Police apprehended 11 individuals suspected of being part of a fake job scam and non-existent investment syndicate during a raid on two residential units in the city at approximately 6pm on Monday.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (May 1): Police apprehended 11 individuals suspected of being part of a fake job scam and non-existent investment syndicate during a raid on two residential units in the city at approximately 6pm on Monday.

Johor police chief CP M Kumar stated that they comprised two local men, eight foreign men, and one foreign woman, all aged between 28 and 45.

"Police also seized 41 mobile phones, six computers, three ATM cards, a WiFi modem and router, and a set

title: China's economic outlook is far from gloomy
summary: CHINA's vast economy — 1.4 billion people spread over 9.6 million square kilometers and a $18 trillion GDP — is made up of so many distinct and disparate features that any observer can easily find themes to support a predetermined optimistic or pessimistic outlook.
content:
CHINA's vast economy — 1.4 billion people spread over 9.6 million square kilometers and a $18 trillion GDP — is made up of so many distinct and disparate features that any observer can easily find themes to support a predetermined optimistic or pessimistic outlook.

Viewed through a pessimistic lens, the contrast between sophisticated Shanghai and rural Guizhou province could not be sharper. Housing costs in prosperous coastal cities severely impede population mobility — and

title: Starbucks reports surprise drop in same-store sales; shares tumble
summary: LONDON: Starbucks on Tuesday reported a fall in same-store sales for the first time in about three years as it battled weak demand for its coffees in the U.S. and China, its two biggest markets, sending its shares down 11 ...
content:
LONDON: Starbucks on Tuesday reported a fall in same-store sales for the first time in about three years as it battled weak demand for its coffees in the U.S. and China, its two biggest markets, sending its shares down 11 per cent in extended trading.

The coffee chain's second-quarter global comparable sales fell 4 per cent, compared with a 1.44 per cent rise estimated by analysts, according to LSEG data. It also missed estimates for quarterly profit by a wide margin.

"In a highly challenged environment, this quarter

title: Tony Fernandes: AirAsia to introduce sustainability fee in airfare 'soon'
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Capital A Bhd chief executive officer Tan Sri Tony Fernandes has said that its airlines will charge a sustainability fee "soon", exclusively for carbon offset projects."We are also incorporating a sustainability fee in our airfares soon, exclusively ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Capital A Bhd chief executive officer Tan Sri Tony Fernandes has said that its airlines will charge a sustainability fee "soon", exclusively for carbon offset projects.

"We are also incorporating a sustainability fee in our airfares soon, exclusively for carbon offset projects, prioritising investments in our region through initiatives like Carbon Offsetting and Reduction Scheme for International Aviation (CORSIA) for a globally balanced approach," its CEO, Tan Sri Tony Fernandes said in his inaugural letter to sh

title: Japan's factory activity falls slow, PMI shows
summary: TOKYO: Japan's factory activity shrank at a slower pace in April as declines in output and new orders eased, a private-sector survey showed on Wednesday.
content:
TOKYO: Japan's factory activity shrank at a slower pace in April as declines in output and new orders eased, a private-sector survey showed on Wednesday.

Inflationary pressure continued but firms found market demand was strong enough to allow them to raise output costs, the survey found.

The final au Jibun Bank Japan manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) rose to 49.6 in April from 48.2 in March, but was off the 49.9 reported in the flash PMI.

The index s

title: Gold hovers near 4-week low, traders eye Fed meeting
summary: LONDON: Gold prices lingered near a four-week low on Wednesday, with investors turning their attention to the outcome of the U.S. Federal Reserve's policy meeting for more signals on its rate cut timeline.FUNDAMENTALS* Spot gold was little ...
content:
LONDON: Gold prices lingered near a four-week low on Wednesday, with investors turning their attention to the outcome of the U.S. Federal Reserve's policy meeting for more signals on its rate cut timeline.

FUNDAMENTALS

* Spot gold was little changed at $2,288.21 per ounce as of 0023 GMT. Prices fell as much as 2 per cent to their lowest level since April 5 on Tuesday, due to an uptick in the dollar and U.S. Treasury yields.

* U.S. gold futures were down 0.2 per cent at US$2,298.70 per ounce.

* Focus is no

title: Wall Street stocks fall as markets weigh strong wage data, Fed meeting
summary: NEW YORK: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday as markets weighed economic data showing rising labor costs and deteriorating consumer confidence on the day of a key Federal Reserve policy meeting to decide the direction of interest rates.Data ...
content:
NEW YORK: U.S. stocks ended lower on Tuesday as markets weighed economic data showing rising labor costs and deteriorating consumer confidence on the day of a key Federal Reserve policy meeting to decide the direction of interest rates.

Data showed on Tuesday that U.S. labor costs rose by a more-than-expected 1.2 per cent last quarter, indicating an uptick in wage pressures. A survey also found that U.S. consumer confidence worsened in April, dropping to its lowest level in more than 1-1/2 years.

The reports came a day be

title: China's factory, services activity growth slows in April
summary: BEIJING: China's manufacturing and services activity both expanded at a slower pace in April, official surveys showed on Tuesday, suggesting some loss of momentum for the world's second-biggest economy at the start of the second quarter.The survey ...
content:
BEIJING: China's manufacturing and services activity both expanded at a slower pace in April, official surveys showed on Tuesday, suggesting some loss of momentum for the world's second-biggest economy at the start of the second quarter.

The survey outcomes underline the challenges facing policymakers even though solid first quarter GDP growth has reduced some of the urgency to ramp up stimulus measures.

The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) dropped to 50.4 i

title: US Treasury to borrow US$243b in 2Q, higher than January forecast
summary: The US Treasury said on Monday it expects to borrow US$243 billion (RM1.1 trillion) in the second quarter, US$41 billion more than the January estimate largely due to lower cash receipts, partially offset by a higher cash balance at the ...
content:
The US Treasury said on Monday it expects to borrow US$243 billion (RM1.1 trillion) in the second quarter, US$41 billion more than the January estimate largely due to lower cash receipts, partially offset by a higher cash balance at the beginning of the quarter.

The second-quarter financing estimate assumes a cash balance of US$750 billion at the end of June, the Treasury said in a statement.

Attention now turns to Wednesday when the Treasury will detail its borrowing plans and auction sizes of various maturities.

W

title: Boeing taps debt market to raise US$10bil
summary: Boeing on Monday tapped debt markets to raise US$10 billion (RM47.6 billion), after the US planemaker burned US$3.93 billion in free cash during the first quarter as production of its best-selling jet declined, sources familiar with the matter said.Boeing ...
content:
Boeing on Monday tapped debt markets to raise US$10 billion (RM47.6 billion), after the US planemaker burned US$3.93 billion in free cash during the first quarter as production of its best-selling jet declined, sources familiar with the matter said.

Boeing shares rose 3.4% after the successful sale. Ratings agencies last week slashed the outlook on Boeing's credit to just above "junk" status. On Monday, both assigned ratings nearing junk to Boeing's new senior unsecured notes, with S&P assigning a BBB- rating and

title: MKHOP ends debut day at 61.5 sen
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: MKH Oil Palm (East Kalimantan) Bhd (MKHOP) made its Main Market debut on Tuesday, which saw a marginal increase of 1.6 per cent from its initial public offering (IPO) price of 62 sen.The wholly-owned unit of property developer MKH ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: MKH Oil Palm (East Kalimantan) Bhd (MKHOP) made its Main Market debut on Tuesday, which saw a marginal increase of 1.6 per cent from its initial public offering (IPO) price of 62 sen.

The wholly-owned unit of property developer MKH Bhd saw some 12.13 million shares traded.

MKHOP announced prior to the listing that the Malaysian public had oversubscribed their IPO by 8.43 times.

Rakuten Trade Research reiterated a buy on the counter with a fair value of 68 sen, a 30 per cent discount to its listed peers

title: ENGIE, UAC ink 20-year power purchase deal
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: ENGIE, a firm specialising in low-carbon energy and services, and UAC Bhd, a manufacturer of environmentally friendly cellulose fibre cement products, have forged a 20-year solar Power Purchase Agreement (PPA).This pact will govern a rooftop solar array ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: ENGIE, a firm specialising in low-carbon energy and services, and UAC Bhd, a manufacturer of environmentally friendly cellulose fibre cement products, have forged a 20-year solar Power Purchase Agreement (PPA).

This pact will govern a rooftop solar array that ENGIE will develop for UAC's manufacturing plant in Tasek Industrial Estate, Ipoh in Perak.

The 7.35-megawatt peak (MWp) rooftop solar array will enable UAC to meet 27 per cent of its energy requirements at its plant with clean energy, resulting in

title: Straits Energy speeds up marine biofuel transition
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Sustainable marine biofuels has the potential to significantly mitigate carbon emissions and decrease the overall carbon footprint of maritime operations within the shipping industry, according to Datuk Sri Ron Ho Kam Choy, managing director of Straits Energy Resources ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Sustainable marine biofuels has the potential to significantly mitigate carbon emissions and decrease the overall carbon footprint of maritime operations within the shipping industry, according to Datuk Sri Ron Ho Kam Choy, managing director of Straits Energy Resources Berhad (SERB).

He said that although sustainable marine biofuels hold significant promise, it's crucial for shipping industry participants to validate the sustainability of the bio-content within their fuels.

Ho highlighted the pivotal ro

title: Bursa Malaysia upbeat about meeting all 5 KPIs
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia believes it will meet all five headline key performance indicators (KPIs) for financial year ending 2024 after closing the first quarter with a 33.6 per cent jump in net profit.The stock market regulator posted a net profit ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia believes it will meet all five headline key performance indicators (KPIs) for financial year ending 2024 after closing the first quarter with a 33.6 per cent jump in net profit.

The stock market regulator posted a net profit profit of RM75.0 million for the quarter ended March 31 2024, up from RM56.2 million reported a year ago.

Group revenue increased to RM187.20 million against RM156.50 million previously.

Bursa said this was driven by a 23.0 per cent year-on-year (y-o-y) increase in t

title: Interest in sustainability on the rise, says EY
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Consumers are increasingly interested in sustainability and envisioning a future fueled by clean energy.However, many are reluctant to invest additional resources to bolster their sustainability endeavors in energy consumption, according to the EY report, "Energy Transition Consumer ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Consumers are increasingly interested in sustainability and envisioning a future fueled by clean energy.

However, many are reluctant to invest additional resources to bolster their sustainability endeavors in energy consumption, according to the EY report, "Energy Transition Consumer Insights."

The report revealed that 81 per cent of energy consumers in Malaysia believe they are already making the most of their efforts to be sustainable.

About 85 per cent of Malaysians said that the responsibility of m

title: HLIB Research retains 'hold' stance on Axiata
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Axiata Group Bhd's Indonesian subsidiary, PT XL Axiata, beat expectations with a first-quarter (Q1) 2024 net profit of 547 billion rupiah, according to Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB).HLIB said that this figure represents 34 per cent of the ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Axiata Group Bhd's Indonesian subsidiary, PT XL Axiata, beat expectations with a first-quarter (Q1) 2024 net profit of 547 billion rupiah, according to Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB).

HLIB said that this figure represents 34 per cent of the full-year estimate on the street.

"The positive surprise was thanks to stronger-than-expected earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation (ebitda) margins and a lower-than-expected tax rate," it said in a note.

Besides that, HLIB said

title: 'Hold' call maintained on Nestle
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Nestle (Malaysia) Bhd may continue to encounter challenges due to the uncertainty stemming from fluctuations in commodity and energy prices, compounded by a depreciating currency, according to Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB).HLIB said the forthcoming subsidy ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Nestle (Malaysia) Bhd may continue to encounter challenges due to the uncertainty stemming from fluctuations in commodity and energy prices, compounded by a depreciating currency, according to Hong Leong Investment Bank Bhd (HLIB).

HLIB said the forthcoming subsidy rationalisation, coupled with the recent increase in sales and service taxes (SST) and introduction of the High-Value Goods Tax (tentatively delayed), could further burden consumer expenditure.

"Management reiterates that the volatile economic env

title: Oil eases on higher US crude output
summary: Oil prices fell 1% on Tuesday, extending losses from Monday, on the back of rising US crude production, as well as hopes of an Israel-Hamas ceasefire.
content:
Brent crude futures for June, which expired on Tuesday, settled down 54 cents, or 0.6%, at US$87.86 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures were down 70 cents, or 0.9%, at US$81.93.

HOUSTON: Oil prices fell 1% on Tuesday, extending losses from Monday, on the back of rising US crude production, as well as hopes of an Israel-Hamas ceasefire.

title: Public Mutual declares distributions of RM130mil for four funds
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Public Bank Bhd’s wholly-owned subsidiary, Public Mutual Bhd has declared distributions amounting to over RM130mil for four funds.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Public Bank Bhd’s wholly-owned subsidiary, Public Mutual Bhd has declared distributions amounting to over RM130mil for four funds.

In a statement, the unit trust company said the gross distributions declared are 1.50 sen per unit for Public Ehs

title: Southeast Asia remains off-track in net zero ambitions
summary: Southeast Asian governments are grappling with the challenges of rising energy demand, a burgeoning middle class, strong pressure not to increase energy and electricity prices, and the need to deliver just and equitable growth — before even considering ambitious plans to decarbonise and build industries of tomorrow.
content: This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on April 29, 2024 - May 5, 2024

title: Apex Equity's auditor unconvinced group can recover RM24m loan
summary: Apex Equity Holdings Bhd's external auditor is unconvinced that the group will be able to recover RM23.8 million in loan receivable, though its directors is confident that the sum is recoverable and had made no impairment loss in its financial statements for the year ended Dec 31, 2023.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): Apex Equity Holdings Bhd's external auditor is unconvinced that the group will be able to recover RM23.8 million in loan receivable, though its directors is confident that the sum is recoverable and had made no impairment loss in its financial statements for the year ended Dec 31, 2023.

Its auditor — Crowe Malaysia PLT — said it is unable to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence to support the recoverability of the sum, citing changes in circumstances after the reporting period tha

title: Defence ministers of Malaysia, Indonesia discuss security, regional preparedness
summary: The meeting between Defence Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin and his Indonesian counterpart Prabowo Subianto on Tuesday discussed various issues, including security challenges and promoting stability in the Southeast Asian region.
content:
JAKARTA (May 1): The meeting between Defence Minister Datuk Seri Mohamed Khaled Nordin and his Indonesian counterpart Prabowo Subianto on Tuesday discussed various issues, including security challenges and promoting stability in the Southeast Asian region.

Both ministers are committed to continue supporting Asean as a peaceful, free and neutral zone thus contributing to the well-being of the region amidst the current challenges.

title: Bursa, SimePlant, SEGi, Capital A, Duopharma, Rimbunan Sawit, MKHOP, Tasco, CIMB, Atrium REIT, KSL, GUH, Lebtech, Mentiga, Ge-Shen, Green Packet, Apex Equity
summary: Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Tuesday (April 30):
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Tuesday (April 30):

Stock exchange operator Bursa Malaysia Bhd net profit rose 34% to RM75.03 million for the financial quarter ended March 31, 2024 (1QFY2024), from RM56.17 million a year before, thanks to higher trading activity and fees from listings and other services. Revenue climbed nearly 20% year-on-year (y-o-y) to RM187.2 million,

title: Festive sales and better margins lift F&N’s 2Q net profit by 63%
summary: Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd (F&N) posted a net profit of RM165.41 million in the second quarter ended March 31, 2024 (2QFY2024), higher by 63.48% compared to RM101.18 million a year before, driven by higher sales amid Chinese New Year and Hari Raya festival seasons and better margins.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 30): Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd (F&N) posted a net profit of RM165.41 million in the second quarter ended March 31, 2024 (2QFY2024), 63.48% more than the RM101.18 million it made a year before, driven by higher sales amid the Chinese New Year and Hari Raya festivals, and better margins.

The better margin stems from a favourable product mix, lower input costs, better manufacturing overhead efficiencies, and savings in the supply chain, the food and beverage company’s local bourse fi

title: Malaysian universities rise in Times Higher Education’s 2024 Asia rankings
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): Malaysia’s top six universities have soared in Times Higher Education’s (THE) 2024 Asia University Rankings, compared to last year’s performance.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): Malaysia’s top six universities have soared in Times Higher Education’s (THE) 2024 Asia University Rankings, compared to last year’s performance.

THE chief global affairs officer Phil Baty attributed this to Malaysia’s higher education sector’s keenness to significantly improve its internationalisation. This means Malaysia is attracting global talent, international students and increased collaboration, all of which is likely to improve the country’s universities even further in the rankin

title: Selangor govt aiming to eradicate hardcore poverty by July — Amirudin
summary:
The Selangor government aims to eradicate hardcore poverty in the state by July, says Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari.

He said this was based on the briefing from the Selangor Development Action Council which recorded a total of 861 families still in the hardcore poor category.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 1): The Selangor government aims to eradicate hardcore poverty in the state by July, says Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari.

He said this was based on the briefing from the Selangor Development Action Council which recorded a total of 861 families still in the hardcore poor category.

He said the State Economic Planning Unit (UPEN) had been instructed to disburse the surplus funds from the Selangor Prosperous Living Assistance (Bingkas),

title: Parents' right to pick children's educational stream — Nik Nazmi
summary: The federal government is always committed to empowering national schools, but parents retain the right to choose the educational stream for their children, said PKR vice-president Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 1): The federal government is always committed to empowering national schools, but parents retain the right to choose the educational stream for their children, said PKR vice-president Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad.

He said it was improper of Pasir Mas MP and PAS information chief Ahmad Fadhli Shaari to challenge Pakatan Harapan (PH) candidate Pang Sock Tao to declare her educational background for primary and secondary schools.

“Does Ahmad Fadhli belie

title: Cyberjaya Education's RM15 mil sale of Asia Metropolitan University falls through
summary: The proposed sale of Cyberjaya Education Group Bhd's Asia Metropolitan University license and business to Austin Legacy Education Sdn Bhd for RM15 million cash has fallen through.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 30): The proposed sale of Cyberjaya Education Group Bhd's Asia Metropolitan University license and business to Austin Legacy Education Sdn Bhd for RM15 million cash has fallen through.

In a bourse filing on Tuesday, the private education provider said that Asiamet (M) Sdn Bhd, notified Austin Legacy that clause 5.3 of the sale and purchase of business agreement was not fulfilled, resulting in the termination of the agreement.

Asiamet (M) is a

title: Appreciation of history: A pathway to national unity
summary: It was my privilege to have had the opportunity to participate in the Sejahtera Malaysia Forum on April 29, at Le Quadri Hotel, Kuala Lumpur, where the Minister of National Unity Malaysia, Datuk Aaron Ago Dagang, delivered the keynote address alongside distinguished panel speakers such as Dr Kelvin Yii Lee Wuen, MP of Kuching, Faye Lim, founder of The Rojak Projek, and Tan Sri Michael Yeoh, president of the KSI Strategic Institute for the Asia-Pacific. I was struck by the profound depth of our discourse.
content: KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): It was my privilege to have had the opportunity to participate in the Sejahtera Malaysia Forum on April 29, at Le Quadri Hotel, Kuala Lumpur, where the Minister of National Unity Malaysia, Datuk Aaron Ago Dagang, delivered the keynote address alongside distinguished panel speakers such as Dr Kelvin Yii Lee Wuen, MP of Kuching, Faye Lim, founder of The Rojak Projek, and Tan Sri Michael Yeoh, president of the KSI Strategic Institute for the Asia-Pacific. I was struck by the profound depth of our discourse.

title: Tasco’s 4Q profit fell 18% amid lower freight rates; declares 2.35 sen dividend
summary: Logistics solutions provider Tasco Bhd saw its net profit for the financial quarter ended March 31, 2024 (4QFY2024) fell 18% year-on-year, attributable to lower profit reported in its air freight forwarding and ocean freight forwarding divisions, as freight rates fell to pre-pandemic levels.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 1): Logistics solutions provider Tasco Bhd saw its net profit for the financial quarter ended March 31, 2024 (4QFY2024) fell 18% year-on-year, attributable to lower profit reported in its air freight forwarding and ocean freight forwarding divisions, as freight rates fell to pre-pandemic levels.

Net profit for the quarter stood at RM17.86 million, down from 4QFY2023's RM21.8 million, though revenue edged up 0.7% to RM268.46 million from RM266.64 million.

title: What stellar GDP figures can mask
summary: South Korea’s economy expanded at a much faster pace than expected in the first quarter of this year, offering relief to those concerned about the severe slump experienced last year persisting for an extended period.
content:
Full recovery: A worker inspects container shipments at the Port of Busan. South Korea is expected to revise its 2.1% growth projection upward as early as May. — Bloomberg

SOUTH Korea’s economy expanded at a much faster pace than expected in the first quarter of this year, offering relief to those concerned about the severe slump experienced last year persisting for an extended period.

This news is especially welcome for a country still grappling with d

title: Funds cover CBOT wheat shorts but bearish streak nears record
summary: Speculators have been holding a near record short across Chicago grains and oilseeds for most of this year, but last week they staged their biggest round of short covering since mid-2023 as supply uncertainties creep back in.
content:
The new net short is a seven-week low but remains historically large. — Reuters

SPECULATORS have been holding a near record short across Chicago grains and oilseeds for most of this year, but last week they staged their biggest round of short covering since mid-2023 as supply uncertainties creep back in.

Wheat was the biggest mover with July futures up 6.7% in the week ended April 23, and money managers reduced their net short position in CBOT wheat fut

title: Lamborghini tiptoes toward EV with new SUV
summary: Lamborghini SpA unveiled a hybrid version of its bestselling Urus sport utility vehicle (SUV) on April 24, in a bid to diversify its range without going fully electric.
content:
Mean machine: Visitors looking at the Urus SE at a Volkswagen Group media event in Beijing. The Urus SE comes with all-wheel drive, 11 drive modes and 37 miles of all-electric driving range. — AP

ROME: Lamborghini SpA unveiled a hybrid version of its bestselling Urus sport utility vehicle (SUV) on April 24, in a bid to diversify its range without going fully electric.

title: Top Glencore shareholders favour keeping coal
summary: Several of Glencore Plc’s largest shareholders say the company should retain its coal assets, according to people familiar with the matter, throwing a proposed spinoff into doubt.
content:
Glencore’s coal business is one of its most profitable units, driving record returns in recent years. — Bloomberg

ZURICH: Several of Glencore Plc’s largest shareholders say the company should retain its coal assets, according to people familiar with the matter, throwing a proposed spinoff into doubt.

Glencore, the world’s largest shipper of thermal coal with a market capitalisation of about US$73bil, had said it intended to spin the business off within

title: BHP’s Anglo buyout makes business sense if the price is right
summary: BHP Group’s proposed takeover of rival miner Anglo American is one of those rare instances where a mega-merger actually makes strong business sense, but it will be difficult to pull off to the satisfaction of all parties.
content:
The expectation now is that BHP may boost its offer, or other buyers for Anglo, or parts of its diversified portfolio, may emerge. — Reuters

BHP Group’s proposed takeover of rival miner Anglo American is one of those rare instances where a mega-merger actually makes strong business sense, but it will be difficult to pull off to the satisfaction of all parties.

title: Let foreign investments boost the Philippines
summary: Many problems keep the ordinary Filipino up at night. A recent Pulse Asia survey commissioned by the Stratbase Institute said seven in 10 Filipinos are deeply concerned with the escalating inflation crisis. This concern is first on the list of respondents’ urgent national concerns.
content:
Feeling the heat: A vendor preparing his umbrella as hot days continue in Manila. Businesses’ less-than-upbeat sentiment is justified as they are directly at risk, and suffer from the constraints and roadblocks that keep the economy from achieving its full potential. — AP

title: Signs of progress in the heart of a global methane hotspot
summary: Roughly half a century ago, geologists exploring for hydrocarbons accidentally shattered the roof of a huge underground gas deposit opening a crater 60m wide.
content:
The Darvaza Crater, nicknamed the Gates of Hell, for years was promoted as a tourist attraction in the central Asia country of Turkmenistan. — Bloomberg

NEW YORK: Roughly half a century ago, geologists exploring for hydrocarbons accidentally shattered the roof of a huge underground gas deposit opening a crater 60m wide.

title: Some respite for Boeing in US$10bil bond offering
summary: Boeing Co raised US$10bil from a bond sale that attracted about US$77bil of orders and allowed the planemaker to ease some of its financial strains by refinancing part of its massive debt load.
content:
Solid backing: A Southwest Airlines Boeing 737-800 being guided to a gate at Baltimore-Washington Airport in Baltimore, Maryland. Boeing has the tools to defend its investment-grade status. — Bloomberg

title: Multi-strategy hedge fund launches tumble
summary: New multi-strategy hedge fund launches accounted for less than one in 10 of new funds in the first quarter, down from about one in four in the last quarter of 2023, according to data provider Preqin.
content:
It’s a sign that investors witnessing higher market volatility might be seeking less risky prospects. — Reuters

LONDON: New multi-strategy hedge fund launches accounted for less than one in 10 of new funds in the first quarter, down from about one in four in the last quarter of 2023, according to data provider Preqin.

It’s a sign that investors witnessing higher market volatility might be seeking less risky prospects.

title: Australian March retail sales in unexpected decline
summary: Australian retail sales fell unexpectedly in March as cautious consumers pulled back spending amid elevated costs of living, while the growth in annual sales slowed to the lowest in more than two years.
content:
ABS data showed retail sales fell 0.4% in March from February, helped by spending associated with sold-out Taylor Swift concerts. — Reuters

SYDNEY: Australian retail sales fell unexpectedly in March as cautious consumers pulled back spending amid elevated costs of living, while the growth in annual sales slowed to the lowest in more than two years.

The Australian dollar slipped 0.2% to A$0.6551 after the data while three-year bond futures extended earl

title: Public caning: No discussions between Terengganu, federal govts, says Azalina
summary: There have been no discussions between the Terengganu state government and the federal government regarding the proposal to implement public caning for shariah offences in the state.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (April 30): There have been no discussions between the Terengganu state government and the federal government regarding the proposal to implement public caning for shariah offences in the state.

Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Law and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said said the proposal would not be easy to implement.
